name: places/ChIJeSk5Yq9YwokRQpjsEEtuPMM
formattedAddress: 301 E 94th St, New York, NY 10128, USA
adrFormatAddress: 301 E 94th St, New York, NY 10128-4719, USA

editorialSummary.text: High-rise hotel offering studios & apartments with full kitchens & free Wi-Fi, plus a fitness room.

originalText.text:
This is not a 5 star hotel for multiple reasons…

1. There’s no service. It’s extremely difficult to get a hold of front desk when you call using the hotel phone. Most of the time they didn’t answer so if you needed something as simple as water, you had to walk to the front desk to request it.

2. Water bottles in the room are not complementary. You are given two small bottles upon check in. If you request more water you will be charged.

3. We were stuck walking up/down 12 floors because the elevators were out of service on multiple occasions.

4. Complementary toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, shower gel) were not great. They provided the bare minimum in the guest rooms. Definitely lacking for a five star hotel.

Not staying here again.

originalText.text: My husband and I stayed at the Marmara Manhattan for 3 weeks and absolutely loved it! The studio room was perfect, spacious and comfortable and had everything we needed. The building is beautiful and location is fantastic! The Q subway is literally outside the door. On top of all of that the staff is phenomenal. So friendly, helpful and professional. They really go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and have everything you need and more. I can't recommend this hotel enough! Our 2 cats loved it too :)

text.text: My husband and I stayed at the Marmara Manhattan for 3 weeks and absolutely loved it! The studio room was perfect, spacious and comfortable and had everything we needed. The building is beautiful and location is fantastic! The Q subway is literally outside the door. On top of all of that the staff is phenomenal. So friendly, helpful and professional. They really go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and have everything you need and more. I can't recommend this hotel enough! Our 2 cats loved it too :)

originalText.text: Super friendly staff! The room was really nice, the AC was great and blocked out most sounds of traffic. There were plenty of toiletries and the kitchen had many dishes and coffee supplies. The bed was very comfy. The closets we're spacious and the balcony was clean.

text.text: Super friendly staff! The room was really nice, the AC was great and blocked out most sounds of traffic. There were plenty of toiletries and the kitchen had many dishes and coffee supplies. The bed was very comfy. The closets we're spacious and the balcony was clean.

originalText.text: I've stayed at a lot (a lot!!) of hotels in Manhattan over the years, but my recent stay at The Marmara Manhattan has been my favorite. The unique, three bedroom, apartment-style suite was huge with a great view. The staff was courteous, friendly, and effective. I was worried the location would be remote--tucked away in a corner of the relatively sleepy Upper East Side--but the immediate area proved to be wonderful in terms of finding high-quality restaurants, laid-back bars, etc.

text.text: I've stayed at a lot (a lot!!) of hotels in Manhattan over the years, but my recent stay at The Marmara Manhattan has been my favorite. The unique, three bedroom, apartment-style suite was huge with a great view. The staff was courteous, friendly, and effective. I was worried the location would be remote--tucked away in a corner of the relatively sleepy Upper East Side--but the immediate area proved to be wonderful in terms of finding high-quality restaurants, laid-back bars, etc.

originalText.text: Great experience at the Marmara.  Most comfortable bed I've ever had at a hotel, extremely spacious and efficient accomodations, exceptionally courteous staff.  Greatly appreciated the thoughtful little touches, like the umbrella they let us borrow and the local area guidance.  However, one of the two elevators was out on Saturday, creating a long queue to depart from the upper floors.  Also, the bathrooms lacked electrical outlets, which I found a bit odd.  But the incredible value of the price more than made up for the datedness and maintenance issues.
